summary: This bill, the Mentoring and Supporting Families Act (H.R. 5383), amends Section 2008 of the Social Security Act to prioritize grant applications that incorporate peer support, mentoring, and career coaching within case management plans. It directs the Secretary to give preference to applications with these features and those that provide stipends or wage supplements. These services may be available before, during, and after training. The effective date is October 1, 2025.
